title.narrative: Improved production, marketing and protection of livelihoods in Herat/ZendaJan district, Afghanistan

description.narrative: Farmers will be get tangle support in saffron cultivation, marketing and access to business companies. Similar initiative last year showed satisfactory results in target villages. There are other farmers willing to cultivate saffron, and need specific inputs, knowledge, and skills. Also the project will supported on: - -Animal husbandry interventions -Women support through provision of market-driven vocational trainings in carpet weaving, hand embroidery and towel weaving -Provision of silk worm eggs and trainings -Provision of safe drinking water - 800 women will receive silk worm eggs and training - 60 farmers will get garlic bulbs and trainings - 60 farmers will be given improved sesame seeds and training - 160 farmers will get improved wheat seeds and training - 40 farmers will receive coriander seeds and training - 50 families with be given access to safe drinking water - 450 families will be benefitted from support of 3 established- milk collection points

Through the prioritization process, the community advised CRDSA assessment team that they require a multi-focused and integrated support in their agriculture, livestock keeping, sericulture and women income generation activities so that they have an improved livelihoods status which is sustainable and productive. They detailed out potential support areas as follows: -Supporting and extension of saffron, sesame, wheat, coriander and garlic cultivation -Animal husbandry support interventions -Women support through provision of market-driven vocational trainings in carpet weaving, hand embroidery and towel weaving -Provision of silk worm eggs and trainings -Provision of safe drinking water
